00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Interface to the hardware Fetch and Add Unit.
00044  *
00045  */
00046 
00047 #ifndef __CVMX_FAU_H__
00048 #define __CVMX_FAU_H__
00049 
00050 #include "cvmx-hwfau.h"
00051 
00052 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00053 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00054 extern "C" {
00055 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00056 #endif
00057 
00058 extern CVMX_TLS uint8_t* cvmx_fau_regs_ptr;
00059 
00060 /**
00061  * Initializes fau, on devices with FAU hw this is a noop.
00062  */
00063 extern int cvmx_fau_init(void);
00064 
00065 /**
00066  * Return the location of emulated FAU register
00067  */
00068 static inline uint8_t* __cvmx_fau_sw_addr(int reg)
00069 {
00070     if (cvmx_unlikely(cvmx_fau_regs_ptr == NULL))
00071         cvmx_fau_init();
00072     return (cvmx_fau_regs_ptr + reg);
00073 }
00074 
00075 /**
00076  * Perform an atomic 64 bit add
00077  *
00078  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00079  *                - Step by 8 for 64 bit access.
00080  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00081  *                Note: Only the low 22 bits are available.
00082  * @return Value of the register before the update
00083  */
00084 static inline int64_t cvmx_fau_fetch_and_add64(cvmx_fau_reg64_t reg, int64_t value)
00085 {
00086     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FAU))
00087         return cvmx_hwfau_fetch_and_add64(reg, value);
00088 
00089     return __atomic_fetch_add(CASTPTR(int64_t, __cvmx_fau_sw_addr(reg)),
00090                   value, __ATOMIC_SEQ_CST);
00091 }
00092 
00093 /**
00094  * Perform an atomic 32 bit add
00095  *
00096  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00097  *                - Step by 4 for 32 bit access.
00098  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00099  *                Note: Only the low 22 bits are available.
00100  * @return Value of the register before the update
00101  */
00102 static inline int32_t cvmx_fau_fetch_and_add32(cvmx_fau_reg32_t reg, int32_t value)
00103 {
00104     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FAU))
00105         return cvmx_hwfau_fetch_and_add32(reg, value);
00106 
00107     reg ^= SWIZZLE_32;
00108     return __atomic_fetch_add(CASTPTR(int32_t, __cvmx_fau_sw_addr(reg)),
00109                   value, __ATOMIC_SEQ_CST);
00110 }
00111 
00112 /**
00113  * Perform an atomic 16 bit add
00114  *
00115  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00116  *                - Step by 2 for 16 bit access.
00117  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00118  * @return Value of the register before the update
00119  */
00120 static inline int16_t cvmx_fau_fetch_and_add16(cvmx_fau_reg16_t reg, int16_t value)
00121 {
00122     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FAU))
00123         return cvmx_hwfau_fetch_and_add16(reg, value);
00124 
00125     reg ^= SWIZZLE_16;
00126     return __atomic_fetch_add(CASTPTR(int16_t, __cvmx_fau_sw_addr(reg)),
00127                   value, __ATOMIC_SEQ_CST);
00128 }
00129 
00130 /**
00131  * Perform an atomic 8 bit add
00132  *
00133  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00134  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00135  * @return Value of the register before the update
00136  */
00137 static inline int8_t cvmx_fau_fetch_and_add8(cvmx_fau_reg8_t reg, int8_t value)
00138 {
00139     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FAU))
00140         return cvmx_hwfau_fetch_and_add8(reg, value);
00141 
00142     reg ^= SWIZZLE_8;
00143     return __atomic_fetch_add(CASTPTR(int8_t, __cvmx_fau_sw_addr(reg)),
00144                   value, __ATOMIC_SEQ_CST);
00145 }
00146 
00147 /**
00148  * Perform an atomic 64 bit add after the current tag switch
00149  * completes
00150  *
00151  * @param reg    FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00152  *               - Step by 8 for 64 bit access.
00153  * @param value  Signed value to add.
00154  *               Note: Only the low 22 bits are available.
00155  * @return If a timeout occurs, the error bit will be set. Otherwise
00156  *         the value of the register before the update will be
00157  *         returned
00158  */
00159 static inline cvmx_fau_tagwait64_t cvmx_fau_tagwait_fetch_and_add64(cvmx_fau_reg64_t reg, int64_t value)
00160 {
00161     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FAU))
00162         return cvmx_hwfau_tagwait_fetch_and_add64(reg, value);
00163 
00164     /* not implemented yet.*/
00165     return (cvmx_fau_tagwait64_t){1, 0};
00166 }
00167 
00168 /**
00169  * Perform an atomic 32 bit add after the current tag switch
00170  * completes
00171  *
00172  * @param reg    FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00173  *               - Step by 4 for 32 bit access.
00174  * @param value  Signed value to add.
00175  *               Note: Only the low 22 bits are available.
00176  * @return If a timeout occurs, the error bit will be set. Otherwise
00177  *         the value of the register before the update will be
00178  *         returned
00179  */
00180 static inline cvmx_fau_tagwait32_t cvmx_fau_tagwait_fetch_and_add32(cvmx_fau_reg32_t reg, int32_t value)
00181 {
00182     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FAU))
00183         return cvmx_hwfau_tagwait_fetch_and_add32(reg, value);
00184 
00185     /* not implemented yet.*/
00186     return (cvmx_fau_tagwait32_t){1, 0};
00187 }
00188

00196  * @return If a timeout occurs, the error bit will be set. Otherwise
00197  *         the value of the register before the update will be

00209 /**

00216  *         the value of the register before the update will be
00217  *         returned

00219 static inline cvmx_fau_tagwait8_t cvmx_fau_tagwait_fetch_and_add8(cvmx_fau_reg8_t reg, int8_t value)
00220 {
00221     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FAU))
00222         return cvmx_hwfau_tagwait_fetch_and_add8(reg, value);
00223 
00224     /* not implemented yet.*/
00225     return (cvmx_fau_tagwait8_t){1, 0};
00226 }
00227 
00228 /**
00229  * Perform an async atomic 64 bit add. The old value is
00230  * placed in the scratch memory at byte address scraddr.
00231  *
00232  * @param scraddr Scratch memory byte address to put response in.
00233  *                Must be 8 byte aligned.
00234  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00235  *                - Step by 8 for 64 bit access.
00236  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00237  *                Note: Only the low 22 bits are available.
00238  * @return Placed in the scratch pad register
00239  */
00240 static inline void cvmx_fau_async_fetch_and_add64(uint64_t scraddr, cvmx_fau_reg64_t reg, int64_t value)
00241 {
00242     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FAU)) {
00243         cvmx_hwfau_async_fetch_and_add64(scraddr, reg, value);
00244         return;
00245     }
00246     cvmx_scratch_write64(scraddr, __atomic_fetch_add(CASTPTR(int64_t,
00247                                  __cvmx_fau_sw_addr(reg)),
00248                              value, __ATOMIC_SEQ_CST));
00249 }
00250 
00251 /**
00252  * Perform an async atomic 32 bit add. The old value is
00253  * placed in the scratch memory at byte address scraddr.
00254  *
00255  * @param scraddr Scratch memory byte address to put response in.
00256  *                Must be 8 byte aligned.
00257  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00258  *                - Step by 4 for 32 bit access.
00259  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00260  *                Note: Only the low 22 bits are available.
00261  * @return Placed in the scratch pad register
00262  */
00263 static inline void cvmx_fau_async_fetch_and_add32(uint64_t scraddr, cvmx_fau_reg32_t reg, int32_t value)
00264 {
00265     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FAU)) {
00266         cvmx_hwfau_async_fetch_and_add32(scraddr, reg, value);
00267         return;
00268     }
00269     cvmx_scratch_write64(scraddr, __atomic_fetch_add(CASTPTR(int32_t, __cvmx_fau_sw_addr(reg)),
00270                                value, __ATOMIC_SEQ_CST));
00271 }
00272 
00273 /**
00274  * Perform an async atomic 16 bit add. The old value is
00275  * placed in the scratch memory at byte address scraddr.
00276  *
00277  * @param scraddr Scratch memory byte address to put response in.
00278  *                Must be 8 byte aligned.
00279  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00280  *                - Step by 2 for 16 bit access.
00281  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00282  * @return Placed in the scratch pad register
00283  */
00284 static inline void cvmx_fau_async_fetch_and_add16(uint64_t scraddr, cvmx_fau_reg16_t reg, int16_t value)
00285 {
00286     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FAU)) {
00287         cvmx_hwfau_async_fetch_and_add16(scraddr, reg, value);
00288         return;
00289     }
00290     cvmx_scratch_write64(scraddr, __atomic_fetch_add(CASTPTR(int16_t,
00291                                  __cvmx_fau_sw_addr(reg)),
00292                              value, __ATOMIC_SEQ_CST));
00293 }
00294 
00295 /**
00296  * Perform an async atomic 8 bit add. The old value is
00297  * placed in the scratch memory at byte address scraddr.
00298  *
00299  * @param scraddr Scratch memory byte address to put response in.
00300  *                Must be 8 byte aligned.
00301  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00302  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00303  * @return Placed in the scratch pad register
00304  */
00305 static inline void cvmx_fau_async_fetch_and_add8(uint64_t scraddr, cvmx_fau_reg8_t reg, int8_t value)
00306 {
00307     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FAU)) {
00308         cvmx_hwfau_async_fetch_and_add8(scraddr, reg, value);
00309         return;
00310     }
00311     cvmx_scratch_write64(scraddr, __atomic_fetch_add(CASTPTR(int8_t, __cvmx_fau_sw_addr(reg)),
00312                              value, __ATOMIC_SEQ_CST));
00313 }
00314 
00315 /**
00316  * Perform an async atomic 64 bit add after the current tag
00317  * switch completes.
00318  *
00319  * @param scraddr Scratch memory byte address to put response in.
00320  *                Must be 8 byte aligned.
00321  *                If a timeout occurs, the error bit (63) will be set. Otherwise
00322  *                the value of the register before the update will be
00323  *                returned
00324  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00325  *                - Step by 8 for 64 bit access.
00326  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00327  *                Note: Only the low 22 bits are available.
00328  * @return Placed in the scratch pad register
00329  */
00330 static inline void cvmx_fau_async_tagwait_fetch_and_add64(uint64_t scraddr, cvmx_fau_reg64_t reg, int64_t value)
00331 {
00332     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FAU)) {
00333         cvmx_hwfau_async_tagwait_fetch_and_add64(scraddr, reg, value);
00334         return;
00335     }
00336 
00337     /* Broken.  Where is the tag wait? */
00338     cvmx_scratch_write64(scraddr, __atomic_fetch_add(CASTPTR(int64_t, __cvmx_fau_sw_addr(reg)),
00339                              value, __ATOMIC_SEQ_CST));
00340 }
00341 
00342 /**
00343  * Perform an async atomic 32 bit add after the current tag
00344  * switch completes.
00345  *
00346  * @param scraddr Scratch memory byte address to put response in.
00347  *                Must be 8 byte aligned.
00348  *                If a timeout occurs, the error bit (63) will be set. Otherwise
00349  *                the value of the register before the update will be
00350  *                returned
00351  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00352  *                - Step by 4 for 32 bit access.
00353  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00354  *                Note: Only the low 22 bits are available.
00355  * @return Placed in the scratch pad register
00356  */
00357 static inline void cvmx_fau_async_tagwait_fetch_and_add32(uint64_t scraddr, cvmx_fau_reg32_t reg, int32_t value)
00358 {
00359     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FAU)) {
00360         cvmx_hwfau_async_tagwait_fetch_and_add32(scraddr, reg, value);
00361         return;
00362     }
00363     /* Broken.  Where is the tag wait? */
00364     cvmx_scratch_write64(scraddr, __atomic_fetch_add(CASTPTR(int32_t,
00365                                  __cvmx_fau_sw_addr(reg)),
00366                              value, __ATOMIC_SEQ_CST));
00367 }
00368 
00369 /**
00370  * Perform an async atomic 16 bit add after the current tag
00371  * switch completes.
00372  *
00373  * @param scraddr Scratch memory byte address to put response in.
00374  *                Must be 8 byte aligned.
00375  *                If a timeout occurs, the error bit (63) will be set. Otherwise
00376  *                the value of the register before the update will be
00377  *                returned
00378  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00379  *                - Step by 2 for 16 bit access.
00380  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00381  * @return Placed in the scratch pad register
00382  */
00383 static inline void cvmx_fau_async_tagwait_fetch_and_add16(uint64_t scraddr, cvmx_fau_reg16_t reg, int16_t value)
00384 {
00385     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FAU)) {
00386         cvmx_hwfau_async_tagwait_fetch_and_add16(scraddr, reg, value);
00387         return;
00388     }
00389     /* Broken.  Where is the tag wait? */
00390     cvmx_scratch_write64(scraddr, __atomic_fetch_add(CASTPTR(int16_t,
00391                                  __cvmx_fau_sw_addr(reg)),
00392                              value, __ATOMIC_SEQ_CST));
00393 }

00395 /**
00396  * Perform an async atomic 8 bit add after the current tag
00397  * switch completes.
00398  *
00399  * @param scraddr Scratch memory byte address to put response in.
00400  *                Must be 8 byte aligned.
00401  *                If a timeout occurs, the error bit (63) will be set. Otherwise
00402  *                the value of the register before the update will be
00403  *                returned
00404  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00405  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00406  * @return Placed in the scratch pad register
00407  */
00408 static inline void cvmx_fau_async_tagwait_fetch_and_add8(uint64_t scraddr, cvmx_fau_reg8_t reg, int8_t value)
00409 {
00410     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FAU)) {
00411         cvmx_hwfau_async_tagwait_fetch_and_add8(scraddr, reg, value);
00412         return;
00413     }
00414     /* Broken.  Where is the tag wait? */
00415     cvmx_scratch_write64(scraddr, __atomic_fetch_add(CASTPTR(int8_t, __cvmx_fau_sw_addr(reg)),
00416                              value, __ATOMIC_SEQ_CST));
00417 }
00418 
00419 /**
00420  * Perform an atomic 64 bit add
00421  *
00422  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00423  *                - Step by 8 for 64 bit access.
00424  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00425  */
00426 static inline void cvmx_fau_atomic_add64(cvmx_fau_reg64_t reg, int64_t value)
00427 {
00428     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FAU)) {
00429         cvmx_hwfau_atomic_add64(reg, value);
00430         return;
00431     }
00432     /* Ignored fetch values should be optimized away */
00433     __atomic_add_fetch(CASTPTR(int64_t, __cvmx_fau_sw_addr(reg)),
00434                value, __ATOMIC_SEQ_CST);
00435 }
00436 
00437 /**
00438  * Perform an atomic 32 bit add
00439  *
00440  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00441  *                - Step by 4 for 32 bit access.
00442  * @param value   Signed value to add.
00443  */
00444 static inline void cvmx_fau_atomic_add32(cvmx_fau_reg32_t reg, int32_t value)
00445 {
00446     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FAU)) {
00447         cvmx_hwfau_atomic_add32(reg, value);
00448         return;
00449     }
00450     reg ^= SWIZZLE_32;
00451     /* Ignored fetch values should be optimized away */
00452     __atomic_add_fetch(CASTPTR(int32_t, __cvmx_fau_sw_addr(reg)),
00453                value, __ATOMIC_SEQ_CST);
00454 }
00455

00460  *                - Step by 2 for 16 bit access.

00462  */
00463 static inline void cvmx_fau_atomic_add16(cvmx_fau_reg16_t reg, int16_t value)
00464 {
00465     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FAU)) {
00466         cvmx_hwfau_atomic_add16(reg, value);
00467         return;

00492 
00493 /**
00494  * Perform an atomic 64 bit write
00495  *
00496  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00497  *                - Step by 8 for 64 bit access.
00498  * @param value   Signed value to write.
00499  */
00500 static inline void cvmx_fau_atomic_write64(cvmx_fau_reg64_t reg, int64_t value)
00501 {
00502     if(octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FAU)) {
00503         cvmx_hwfau_atomic_write64(reg, value);
00504         return;
00505     }
00506     __atomic_store_n(CASTPTR(int64_t, __cvmx_fau_sw_addr(reg)),
00507              value, __ATOMIC_SEQ_CST);
00508 }
00509 
00510 /**
00511  * Perform an atomic 32 bit write
00512  *
00513  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00514  *                - Step by 4 for 32 bit access.
00515  * @param value   Signed value to write.
00516  */
00517 static inline void cvmx_fau_atomic_write32(cvmx_fau_reg32_t reg, int32_t value)
00518 {
00519     if(octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FAU)) {
00520         cvmx_hwfau_atomic_write32(reg, value);
00521         return;
00522     }
00523     reg ^= SWIZZLE_32;
00524     __atomic_store_n(CASTPTR(int32_t, __cvmx_fau_sw_addr(reg)),
00525              value, __ATOMIC_SEQ_CST);
00526 }
00527 
00528 /**
00529  * Perform an atomic 16 bit write
00530  *
00531  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00532  *                - Step by 2 for 16 bit access.
00533  * @param value   Signed value to write.
00534  */
00535 static inline void cvmx_fau_atomic_write16(cvmx_fau_reg16_t reg, int16_t value)
00536 {
00537     if(octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FAU)) {
00538         cvmx_hwfau_atomic_write16(reg, value);
00539         return;
00540     }
00541     reg ^= SWIZZLE_16;
00542     __atomic_store_n(CASTPTR(int16_t, __cvmx_fau_sw_addr(reg)),
00543              value, __ATOMIC_SEQ_CST);
00544 }
00545 
00546 /**
00547  * Perform an atomic 8 bit write
00548  *
00549  * @param reg     FAU atomic register to access. 0 <= reg < 2048.
00550  * @param value   Signed value to write.
00551  */
00552 static inline void cvmx_fau_atomic_write8(cvmx_fau_reg8_t reg, int8_t value)
00553 {
00554     if(octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_FAU)) {
00555         cvmx_hwfau_atomic_write8(reg, value);
00556         return;
00557     }
00558     reg ^= SWIZZLE_8;
00559     __atomic_store_n(CASTPTR(int8_t, __cvmx_fau_sw_addr(reg)),
00560              value, __ATOMIC_SEQ_CST);
00561 }
00562 
00563 /** Allocates 64bit FAU register.
00564  *  @param reserve base address to reserve
00565  *  @return value is the base address of allocated FAU register
00566  */
00567 extern int cvmx_fau64_alloc(int reserve);
00568 
00569 /** Allocates 32bit FAU register.
00570  *  @param reserve base address to reserve
00571  *  @return value is the base address of allocated FAU register
00572  */
00573 extern int cvmx_fau32_alloc(int reserve);
00574 
00575 /** Allocates 16bit FAU register.
00576  *  @param reserve base address to reserve
00577  *  @return value is the base address of allocated FAU register
00578  */
00579 extern int cvmx_fau16_alloc(int reserve);
00580 
00581 /** Allocates 8bit FAU register.
00582  *  @param reserve base address to reserve
00583  *  @return value is the base address of allocated FAU register
00584  */
00585 extern int cvmx_fau8_alloc(int reserve);
00586 
00587 /** Frees the specified FAU register.
00588  *  @param address base address of register to release.
00589  *  @return 0 on success; -1 on failure
00590  */
00591 extern int cvmx_fau_free(int address);
00592

00594  */
00595 extern void cvmx_fau_show(void);
